encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: General - In Fr.2-3, line 16 add dot under ἵ(¨) directly in XML
General - In Fr.2-3, line 16 add dot under ἵ(¨) directly in XML

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - In the notes below I am answering some of the questions posed by the encoder. Implement the changes and process. Text: Fr.1 lin2: <:ὄντ̣[ες]=BKT|ed|ὄντως=mss.:> or is it a typo?: I think it is a typo not worth recording; l. 17: encode the word-break at the end; Fr. 2+3, l. 9. Ὁμή[ρ]--I find this unlikely, perhaps rho was in the next line or the ending in this line? l.16: implement "add dot under ἵ(¨) directly in XML"; Fr. 5, l. 2: correct accent to ἴσως; Fr. 6., l. 1: νομίζουσ] is unlikely wordbreak; Fr. 12, l. 3: <:θῶ=BKT|ed|θῶμεν=mss.:> I think this is a typo in th edition which can be disregarded, thus simply encode the correct form; Fr.13 l. 9:- τῶν [.?]: BKT omits the square bracket, typo?--Yes, this is surely a typo.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - In the notes below I am answering some of the questions posed by the encoder. Implement the changes and process. Text: Fr.1 lin2: <:ὄντ̣[ες]=BKT|ed|ὄντως=mss.:> or is it a typo?: I think it is a typo not worth recording; l. 17: encode the word-break at the end; Fr. 2+3, l. 9. Ὁμή[ρ]--I find this unlikely, perhaps rho was in the next line or the ending in this line? l.16: implement "add dot under ἵ(¨) directly in XML"; Fr. 5, l. 2: correct accent to ἴσως; Fr. 6., l. 1: νομίζουσ] is unlikely wordbreak; Fr. 12, l. 3: <:θῶ=BKT|ed|θῶμεν=mss.:> I think this is a typo in th edition which can be disregarded, thus simply encode the correct form; Fr.13 l. 9:- τῶν [.?]: BKT omits the square bracket, typo?--Yes, this is surely a typo.

Submit - Encoded Greek text +metadata from BKT 9.8 as part of Heidelberg Papyrological Webinar summer 2020. I noticed the following differences between BKT and mss. (Oxford ed.) Fr.1 lin2: <:ὄντ̣[ες]=BKT|ed|ὄντως=mss.:> or is it a typo; lin5: <:μοὶ=BKT|ed|ἐμοὶ=mss.:>; lin8: <:σαυτοῦ=BKT|ed|ἑαυτοῦ=mss.:>; <:ταῦ[τα]=BKT|ed|om.mss.:>; lin16: <:[ἕνε]κα=BKT|ed|ἕνεκεν=mss.:>; lin19: <:Ἑρμοκράτης=BKT|ed Ἑρμογένης=mss.:>; lin23: <:ο[ἴ]κοις=BKT|ed|οἴκῳ=mss.:> Fr.2+3 lin1: <:[ἀγαθὸν]=BKT|ed|ἀγαθὸν εἶναι:>; lin2-3: <:[καὶ]=BKT|ed|καὶ τὸ μὲν ἐργάζεσθαι ἀγαθόν, τὸ δ᾽ ἀργεῖν κακόν=mss.:>. Ιn view of this insertion from the mss, I encoded μὲν at the beginning of lin3, although, according to BKT, the encoding should be: [.?]μεν; lin9: <:[τὸ]ν̣=BKT|ed|τὸ=mss.:>; lin16: tried to add dot under ἵ(¨) directly in XML, but Leiden+ breaks with underdotted ἵ with diaeresis; lin17: <:τε=BKT|ed|τ' ἄνδρα=mss.:>; lin29: <:μήτε=BKT|ed|μήτ'=mss.:> Fr.4 lin15: editor’s three dots at the end of the line I interpreted as [.?] instead of [.3], like in fr.5 lin9, fr.8 lin12, fr.9 lin5, fr.11 lin2, fr.12 lin9, fr.13 lin9 Fr.5 lin9: <:ἂν=BKT|ed|ἂν ἴσως=mss.:> Fr.6 lin2: not sure whether ὡ]ς̣ is underdotted (print unclear because of square bracket in lin3; <:[γράφουσι]=BKT|ed|γράφουσί τε=mss.:> Fr.12 lin3: <:θῶ=BKT|ed|θῶμεν=mss.:>; lin8: <:[δὲ]=BKT|ed|δ'=mss:> Fr.13 lin9:- τῶν [.?]: BKT omits the square bracket, typo? Or is it really on the papyrus. Photograph too vague.

Submit - Encoded Greek text +metadata from BKT 9.8 as part of Heidelberg Papyrological Webinar summer 2020. I noticed the following differences between BKT and mss. (Oxford ed.) Fr.1 lin2: <:ὄντ̣[ες]=BKT|ed|ὄντως=mss.:> or is it a typo; lin5: <:μοὶ=BKT|ed|ἐμοὶ=mss.:>; lin8: <:σαυτοῦ=BKT|ed|ἑαυτοῦ=mss.:>; <:ταῦ[τα]=BKT|ed|om.mss.:>; lin16: <:[ἕνε]κα=BKT|ed|ἕνεκεν=mss.:>; lin19: <:Ἑρμοκράτης=BKT|ed Ἑρμογένης=mss.:>; lin23: <:ο[ἴ]κοις=BKT|ed|οἴκῳ=mss.:> Fr.2+3 lin1: <:[ἀγαθὸν]=BKT|ed|ἀγαθὸν εἶναι:>; lin2-3: <:[καὶ]=BKT|ed|καὶ τὸ μὲν ἐργάζεσθαι ἀγαθόν, τὸ δ᾽ ἀργεῖν κακόν=mss.:>. Ιn view of this insertion from the mss, I encoded μὲν at the beginning of lin3, although, according to BKT, the encoding should be: [.?]μεν; lin9: <:[τὸ]ν̣=BKT|ed|τὸ=mss.:>; lin16: tried to add dot under ἵ(¨) directly in XML, but Leiden+ breaks with underdotted ἵ with diaeresis; lin17: <:τε=BKT|ed|τ' ἄνδρα=mss.:>; lin29: <:μήτε=BKT|ed|μήτ'=mss.:> Fr.4 lin15: editor’s three dots at the end of the line I interpreted as [.?] instead of [.3], like in fr.5 lin9, fr.8 lin12, fr.9 lin5, fr.11 lin2, fr.12 lin9, fr.13 lin9 Fr.5 lin9: <:ἂν=BKT|ed|ἂν ἴσως=mss.:> Fr.6 lin2: not sure whether ὡ]ς̣ is underdotted (print unclear because of square bracket in lin3; <:[γράφουσι]=BKT|ed|γράφουσί τε=mss.:> Fr.12 lin3: <:θῶ=BKT|ed|θῶμεν=mss.:>; lin8: <:[δὲ]=BKT|ed|δ'=mss:> Fr.13 lin9:- τῶν [.?]: BKT omits the square bracket, typo? Or is it really on the papyrus. Photograph too vague.
